article:
Jawan (film)

Jawan is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Atlee and produced by Gauri Khan under the banner of Red Chillies Entertainment. The film features Shah Rukh Khan in a dual role, alongside Nayanthara and Vijay Sethupathi in pivotal roles. Jawan marks the Bollywood debut of Atlee, who is known for his work in Tamil cinema.

# Plot

The plot of Jawan revolves around a mysterious figure who is on a mission to take down a corrupt system. The story follows the journey of this enigmatic character, played by Shah Rukh Khan, as he navigates through the dark underbelly of the system, facing off against powerful adversaries along the way. As the story unfolds, the protagonist's true identity is revealed, and his connection to the larger conspiracy is exposed.

# Cast

* Shah Rukh Khan as dual lead roles
* Nayanthara as the female lead
* Vijay Sethupathi in a pivotal role
* Sanya Malhotra in a supporting role
* Priyamani in a supporting role
* Deepika Padukone in a special appearance

# Production

## Development

Jawan was first announced in June 2021, when Shah Rukh Khan took to social media to reveal the film's title and logo. At the time, it was reported that the film would be directed by Atlee, who had previously worked with Shah Rukh Khan on the Tamil film, Bigil. The film's script was written by Atlee, along with S. Ramanagirivasan and K. P. Selvah.

## Casting

Shah Rukh Khan was the first actor to be cast in the film, playing dual lead roles. Nayanthara was later cast as the female lead, marking her Bollywood debut. Vijay Sethupathi was also cast in a pivotal role, marking his second collaboration with Atlee after Bigil.

## Filming

Principal photography for Jawan began in September 2021 and took place in various locations across India, including Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Chennai. The film's action sequences were choreographed by Anbu-Ariv, who had previously worked on films like Master and Beast.

## Post-production

Post-production work on Jawan began in January 2022, with the film's editing being handled by Ruben. The film's visual effects were handled by Red Chillies VFX, who had previously worked on films like Zero and Dilwale.

# Themes and influences

Jawan explores themes of corruption, power, and redemption, with the film's protagonist on a mission to take down a corrupt system. The film's action sequences and stunts are heavily influenced by Tamil cinema, with Atlee incorporating elements of his previous films into the action choreography.

# Music

The film's soundtrack is composed by Anirudh Ravichander, who had previously worked with Atlee on films like Maan Karate and Theri. The film's score is a mix of electronic and rock elements, with the soundtrack featuring a number of high-energy tracks.

# Marketing

Jawan was heavily marketed by Red Chillies Entertainment, with the film's trailer being released in July 2022. The trailer received a massive response from fans and critics alike, with many praising the film's action sequences and Shah Rukh Khan's performance.

# Release

## Theatrical

Jawan is scheduled to release in theaters on September 2, 2022. The film will be released in multiple languages, including Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu.

## Distribution

Jawan will be distributed by Red Chillies Entertainment, with the film being released in over 5,000 theaters worldwide.

## Home media

Jawan will be available to stream on Netflix after its theatrical release, with the film being available in multiple languages.

# Reception

## Box office

Jawan is expected to perform well at the box office, with many predicting the film to gross over ₹500 crore worldwide.

## Critical response

Jawan has received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's action sequences and Shah Rukh Khan's performance. The film's direction and music have also been praised, with many calling it one of the best films of the year.

# Accolades

Jawan has been nominated for several awards, including the Filmfare Awards and the IIFA Awards.

# Future

Jawan is expected to be followed by a sequel, with Atlee and Shah Rukh Khan reportedly discussing the possibility of a second film.

# Notes

Jawan marks the Bollywood debut of Atlee, who is known for his work in Tamil cinema. The film also marks the Bollywood debut of Nayanthara, who has previously worked in Tamil and Malayalam cinema.

2023 Nashville School Shooting

The 2023 Nashville school shooting was a mass shooting that occurred on March 27, 2023, at Covenant School, a private Christian elementary school in Nashville, Tennessee. The shooting resulted in the deaths of six people, including three children, and has sparked widespread debate and controversy.

# Background

Covenant School is a private Christian elementary school located in the Green Hills neighborhood of Nashville, Tennessee. The school serves students from preschool through sixth grade and has a student body of around 200 students. The school is affiliated with the Presbyterian Church in America and has a strong focus on Christian education.

In the months leading up to the shooting, the United States had experienced a number of high-profile mass shootings, including the 2022 Robb Elementary School shooting in Uvalde, Texas, and the 2022 Club Q shooting in Colorado Springs, Colorado. These shootings had sparked renewed debate about gun control and school safety.

# Shooting

On March 27, 2023, at around 10:15 a.m., a gunman entered Covenant School and began shooting. The gunman was armed with two assault rifles and a handgun, and was wearing a tactical vest and a mask. The shooting occurred in multiple locations throughout the school, including classrooms and hallways.

## Victims

Six people were killed in the shooting, including three children and three adults. The victims were identified as:

* Evelyn Dieckhaus, 9
* Hallie Scruggs, 9
* William Kinney, 9
* Mike Hill, 61
* Cynthia Peak, 61
* Katherine Koonce, 60

In addition to the six fatalities, one person was injured in the shooting.

# Perpetrator

The perpetrator of the shooting was identified as Audrey Hale, a 28-year-old woman from Nashville. Hale was a former student of Covenant School and had graduated from the school in 2013.

article:
Liga 1 (Indonesia)
=====================

Liga 1 is the top professional football division of Indonesian football league system. It was founded in 1994 and is operated by the Football Association of Indonesia (PSSI). The league is contested by 18 clubs and operates on a system of promotion and relegation with Liga 2.

History
--------

### Origins

The Indonesian football league system was first established in 1930, with the formation of the Persatuan Sepakbola Seluruh Indonesia (PSSI). However, the league was not professional and was dominated by amateur clubs. In the 1970s and 1980s, Indonesian football began to gain popularity, and the PSSI started to explore the possibility of creating a professional league.

### Foundation

In 1994, the PSSI founded the Liga Indonesia, which was the precursor to the current Liga 1. The league was initially contested by 28 clubs and was divided into two divisions. The top division, known as the Liga Indonesia Premier Division, was contested by 10 clubs, while the second division, known as the Liga Indonesia First Division, was contested by 18 clubs.

### Dualism

In 2011, the PSSI and the Indonesian Professional Sports Agency (BOPI) signed an agreement to establish a new professional league, known as the Indonesian Super League (ISL). The ISL was contested by 15 clubs and was operated by the PT Liga Indonesia, a subsidiary of the PSSI. However, the PSSI and the PT Liga Indonesia had different visions for the league, which led to a period of dualism in Indonesian football.

### Government intervention and FIFA suspension

In 2015, the Indonesian government intervened in the dispute between the PSSI and the PT Liga Indonesia, and the PSSI was suspended by FIFA. The suspension was lifted in 2016, after the PSSI and the PT Liga Indonesia reached an agreement to merge the two leagues. The new league, known as the Liga 1, was established in 2017.

### Name change

In 2017, the PSSI announced that the Liga Indonesia would be rebranded as the Liga 1. The name change was made to reflect the league's new status as the top professional division of Indonesian football.

Competition format
-------------------

### Competition

The Liga 1 is contested by 18 clubs, with each club playing the others twice, once at home and once away. The club with the most points at the end of the season is crowned the champion.

### Promotion and relegation

The Liga 1 operates on a system of promotion and relegation with the Liga 2. The bottom three clubs in the Liga 1 are relegated to the Liga 2, while the top three clubs in the Liga 2 are promoted to the Liga 1.

### Video assistant referee

The Liga 1 uses video assistant referees (VARs) to assist with decision-making. VARs are used to review decisions made by the on-field referee, such as goals, penalties, and direct red cards.

article:
Oppenheimer (film)

Oppenheimer is a 2023 biographical drama film written and directed by Christopher Nolan. The film is based on the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the director of the Manhattan Project, which developed the atomic bomb during World War II. The film explores Oppenheimer's complex personality, his relationships, and his involvement in the development of the atomic bomb.

# Plot

The film tells the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, a brilliant and charismatic physicist who is recruited to lead the Manhattan Project. As Oppenheimer becomes increasingly obsessed with the project, he must navigate the complexities of his personal relationships and the moral implications of his work. The film explores Oppenheimer's relationships with his colleagues, including Enrico Fermi and Ernest Lawrence, as well as his romantic relationships with Jean Tatlock and Katherine "Kitty" Posen.

As the project progresses, Oppenheimer becomes increasingly consumed by the pressure to succeed, and his relationships begin to suffer. The film culminates with the successful detonation of the atomic bomb in the Trinity test, and Oppenheimer's subsequent grappling with the consequences of his creation.

# Cast

* Cillian Murphy as J. Robert Oppenheimer
* Emily Blunt as Katherine "Kitty" Posen
* Matt Damon as Leslie Groves
* Robert Downey Jr. as Lewis Strauss
* Josh Hartnett as Ernest Lawrence
* Dane DeHaan as Kenneth Nichols
* Alden Ehrenreich as Donald Hornig
* Rami Malek as Lyndon B. Johnson
* Florence Pugh as Jean Tatlock
* Benny Safdie as Edward Teller
* Jack Quaid as Lyall Johnson

# Production

## Development

Christopher Nolan had been interested in telling the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer for many years, and had begun researching the subject in the early 2000s. Nolan was drawn to Oppenheimer's complex personality and the moral implications of his work on the atomic bomb.

In 2019, Nolan announced that he would be directing a film about Oppenheimer, with Cillian Murphy set to star in the title role. The film was set to be produced by Nolan's production company, Syncopy, in association with Atlas Entertainment and Universal Pictures.

## Writing

Nolan spent several years researching and writing the screenplay for Oppenheimer. He drew on a range of sources, including Oppenheimer's personal letters and diaries, as well as historical accounts of the Manhattan Project.

The screenplay explores Oppenheimer's complex personality and his relationships, as well as the moral implications of his work on the atomic bomb. Nolan has said that he was drawn to Oppenheimer's contradictions - his brilliance and charisma, but also his insecurities and flaws.

## Casting

Cillian Murphy was Nolan's first choice to play Oppenheimer, and he was officially cast in the role in 2019. Murphy had previously worked with Nolan on several films, including Batman Begins and Dunkirk.

The rest of the cast was announced over the course of 2020 and 2021, with Emily Blunt, Matt Damon, and Robert Downey Jr. all joining the film. The cast also includes several younger actors, including Dane DeHaan and Alden Ehrenreich.

## Filming

Principal photography on Oppenheimer began in January 2022, and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in the United States and the United Kingdom, with Nolan using a combination of digital and IMAX cameras.

The film's cinematographer, Hoyte van Hoytema, worked closely with Nolan to develop a distinctive visual style for the film. The film's color palette is muted and subdued, with a focus on blues and greys.

## Post-production

Post-production on Oppenheimer began in the spring of 2022, and lasted for several months. The film's editor, Jennifer Lame, worked closely with Nolan to develop a complex and nuanced edit for the film.

The film's visual effects were created by a team of artists and technicians at DNEG, a leading visual effects company. The film's VFX supervisor, Andrew Whitehurst, worked closely with Nolan to develop a range of effects, including the Trinity test sequence.

# Music

The film's score was composed by Ludwig Göransson, who had previously worked with Nolan on Tenet. The score is a complex and nuanced blend of orchestral and electronic elements, with a focus on percussion and strings.

The film also features a range of period-specific music, including jazz and blues tracks from the 1940s.

# Marketing

Marketing for Oppenheimer began in the spring of 2023, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer was widely praised for its atmospheric and evocative tone, and generated significant buzz for the film.

The film's official trailer was released in the summer of 2023, and featured a range of footage from the film. The trailer was widely praised for its intensity and emotion, and helped to generate further buzz for the film.

# Release

## Theatrical

Oppenheimer was released in theaters on July 21, 2023, in the United States and the United Kingdom. The film was released in IMAX and Dolby Cinema formats, with a range of premium audio and visual options.

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its performances, direction, and historical accuracy.

### Classifications and censorship

Oppenheimer received an R rating from the Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) for its language, violence, and some suggestive content.

The film was also rated 15 by the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC) for its strong language, violence, and some suggestive content.

## Home media

Oppenheimer was released on home media in the fall of 2023, with a range of options including digital, DVD, and Blu-ray.

The film's home media release included a range of special features, including deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes footage, and a making-of documentary.

# Reception

## Box office

### United States and Canada

Oppenheimer grossed $45 million in its opening weekend in the United States and Canada, with a per-screen average of $10,000.

The film went on to gross over $150 million in the United States and Canada, making it one of the highest-grossing films of the year.

### Japan

Oppenheimer grossed $20 million in its opening weekend in Japan, with a per-screen average of $5,000.

The film went on to gross over $50 million in Japan, making it one of the highest-grossing foreign films of the year.

### Other territories

Oppenheimer grossed over $100 million in other territories, including the United Kingdom, Australia, and China.

The film's worldwide gross was over $300 million, making it one of the highest-grossing films of the year.

## Critical response

Oppenheimer received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its performances, direction, and historical accuracy.

The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 8.5/10.

The film also holds a 90% approval rating on Metacritic, with an average rating of 8.5/10.

## Influence on legislation

Oppenheimer's portrayal of the development of the atomic bomb and its consequences helped to raise awareness of the need for stricter regulations and safeguards around nuclear technology.

The film's release coincided with a renewed debate around nuclear disarmament and non-proliferation, with many calling for greater international cooperation and action to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons.

# Accuracy and omissions

While Oppenheimer is based on real events and figures, some artistic liberties were taken to enhance the storytelling and drama.

The film's portrayal of Oppenheimer's relationships and personal life was based on historical records and accounts, but some details were altered or omitted for dramatic effect.

# Accolades

Oppenheimer received widespread critical acclaim and won numerous awards and nominations, including several Academy Awards.

The film's cast and crew were recognized for their outstanding work, including Cillian Murphy, who won several awards for his portrayal of Oppenheimer.

2023 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament

The 2023 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament was the 76th edition of the NCAA Division I Baseball Championship, which determined the top college baseball team in the United States. The tournament was held from May 31 to June 26, 2023, and featured 64 teams from across the country.

#Tournament procedure

The tournament was a double-elimination format, with the winners of each regional advancing to the Super Regionals. The winners of the Super Regionals then advanced to the Men's College World Series (MCWS) in Omaha, Nebraska. The MCWS was a double-elimination tournament, with the winners of each bracket advancing to the championship series.

#National seeds

The NCAA announced the 16 national seeds for the tournament on May 29, 2023. The top eight national seeds were:

1. LSU
2. Stanford
3. Arkansas
4. Vanderbilt
5. Wake Forest
6. Virginia
7. Oregon State
8. Texas Tech

#Schedule and venues

The tournament was held from May 31 to June 26, 2023. The regionals were held from May 31 to June 5, with the Super Regionals being held from June 9 to June 12. The Men's College World Series was held from June 16 to June 26 at TD Ameritrade Park in Omaha, Nebraska.

#Bids

##Automatic bids

A total of 31 teams received automatic bids to the tournament, with one team from each conference receiving a bid.

#Regionals and Super Regionals

##Eugene Super Regional

The Eugene Super Regional was held at PK Park in Eugene, Oregon, from June 9 to June 11. The Oregon State Beavers defeated the Vanderbilt Commodores in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Fort Worth Super Regional

The Fort Worth Super Regional was held at Lupton Stadium in Fort Worth, Texas, from June 9 to June 11. The TCU Horned Frogs defeated the Arkansas Razorbacks in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Charlottesville Super Regional

The Charlottesville Super Regional was held at Davenport Field in Charlottesville, Virginia, from June 9 to June 11. The Virginia Cavaliers defeated the Duke Blue Devils in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Gainesville Super Regional

The Gainesville Super Regional was held at McKethan Stadium in Gainesville, Florida, from June 9 to June 11. The Florida Gators defeated the Wake Forest Demon Deacons in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Winston-Salem Super Regional

The Winston-Salem Super Regional was held at Gene Hooks Field at Wake Forest Baseball Park in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, from June 9 to June 11. The Louisville Cardinals defeated the Texas Tech Red Raiders in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Stanford Super Regional

The Stanford Super Regional was held at Klein Field at Sunken Diamond in Stanford, California, from June 9 to June 11. The Stanford Cardinal defeated the UConn Huskies in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Baton Rouge Super Regional

The Baton Rouge Super Regional was held at Alex Box Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, from June 9 to June 11. The LSU Tigers defeated the Mississippi State Bulldogs in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

##Hattiesburg Super Regional

The Hattiesburg Super Regional was held at Pete Taylor Park in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, from June 9 to June 11. The Southern Miss Golden Eagles defeated the LSU Tigers in a best-of-three series, advancing to the Men's College World Series.

article:
Federal Prosecution of Donald Trump (Classified Documents Case)

The federal prosecution of Donald Trump is an ongoing case related to the alleged mishandling of classified documents by the 45th President of the United States. The case has garnered significant attention and sparked intense debate about the handling of sensitive information, executive privilege, and the rule of law.

#Background

In January 2021, the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) requested that the Trump administration return presidential records, including documents marked as classified, that were still in the possession of the former president. After months of negotiations, Trump's representatives handed over 15 boxes of documents to NARA in January 2022. However, upon review, NARA discovered that some of the documents contained markings indicating they were classified.

In February 2022, the Department of Justice (DOJ) launched an investigation into the handling of classified documents by Trump. The investigation was led by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and focused on whether Trump had mishandled classified documents, potentially violating the Espionage Act.

#Indictments and Arraignments

##Original Indictment

On June 8, 2023, a grand jury in the Southern District of Florida indicted Trump on 32 counts related to the mishandling of classified documents. The indictment alleged that Trump had willfully retained, concealed, and failed to return classified documents, including those related to national defense and the nuclear programs of other countries.

##Superseding Indictment

On July 18, 2023, a superseding indictment was unsealed, adding 16 new counts and charging two additional defendants: Waltine Nauta, a former Trump aide, and Carlos De Oliveira, a Trump employee. The superseding indictment alleged that Nauta and De Oliveira had assisted Trump in concealing and removing classified documents from the White House.

##Assignment of District Judge

The case was assigned to District Judge Aileen Cannon of the Southern District of Florida. Judge Cannon had previously served as a law clerk to Judge Steven Colloton of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit.

##Arraignments

###Trump

Trump was arraigned on June 13, 2023, at the federal courthouse in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. He pleaded not guilty to all charges.

###Nauta

Nauta was arraigned on July 20, 2023, and also pleaded not guilty to all charges.

###De Oliveira

De Oliveira was arraigned on July 21, 2023, and pleaded not guilty to all charges.

#Pretrial Proceedings

##2023

In June 2023, Trump's lawyers filed a motion to dismiss the indictment, arguing that the charges were unconstitutional and that the DOJ had overstepped its authority. The motion was denied by Judge Cannon in July 2023.

##2024

###Trump's Request to Indefinitely Delay Trial

In January 2024, Trump's lawyers filed a motion to indefinitely delay the trial, citing the need for more time to review the large volume of evidence and to prepare for the trial. The motion was opposed by the DOJ, which argued that the trial should proceed as scheduled.

#Dismissal and Appeal

On March 15, 2024, Judge Cannon granted Trump's motion to dismiss the indictment, citing the need for further review of the evidence and the potential for executive privilege claims. The DOJ appealed the decision to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit.

#Response

##To Indictment

###Trump

Trump responded to the indictment by calling it a "witch hunt" and claiming that the charges were "fake" and "politically motivated."

###Other Republicans

Many other Republicans, including some of Trump's former allies, condemned the indictment and argued that it was an overreach by the DOJ.

###Democrats

Democrats praised the indictment, arguing that it was a necessary step to hold Trump accountable for his actions and to protect national security.

##To Dismissal

###Trump

Trump responded to the dismissal of the indictment by claiming victory and arguing that the decision vindicated his claims of a "witch hunt."

###DOJ

The DOJ expressed disappointment with the decision and vowed to appeal, arguing that the dismissal was incorrect and that the charges should be reinstated.

article:
Jimmy Buffett is a American singer-songwriter, musician, author, and entrepreneur. He is best known for his island-inspired music and laid-back style, which has endeared him to a devoted fan base known as "Parrot Heads." With a career spanning over five decades, Buffett has become a cultural icon, synonymous with tropical getaways, beach parties, and good times.

# Early life

James William Buffett was born on December 25, 1946, in Pascagoula, Mississippi. He grew up in Mobile, Alabama, and was raised in a middle-class family. Buffett's love for music began at an early age, and he was influenced by the folk and country music of the 1950s and 1960s. He attended the University of Southern Mississippi, where he was a member of the Kappa Sigma fraternity and began to develop his musical talents.

# Music career

Buffett's music career began in the late 1960s, when he started playing gigs in local bars and clubs in New Orleans. He released his first album, "Down to Earth," in 1970, but it was not until the release of his 1977 album "Changes in Latitudes, Changes in Attitudes" that he gained widespread recognition. The album included the hit single "Margaritaville," which has become one of Buffett's signature songs.

## Musical style

Buffett's music is a unique blend of folk, rock, country, and island music. His songs often feature tropical themes, witty lyrics, and catchy melodies. He is known for his laid-back, beachy style, which has been dubbed "island rock" or "tropical rock." Buffett's music has been influenced by a wide range of artists, including Bob Dylan, Willie Nelson, and The Beach Boys.

## Musical legacy

Buffett's music has had a significant impact on popular culture. He has been credited with helping to create the "island rock" genre, and his music has influenced a generation of artists. Buffett has released over 30 studio albums, and he has had numerous chart-topping hits, including "Come Monday," "Fins," and "Cheeseburger in Paradise." He has won numerous awards, including several Grammy nominations.

## "Parrot Head" fans

Buffett's devoted fan base is known as "Parrot Heads." These fans are known for their colorful clothing, tropical accessories, and love of Buffett's music. Parrot Heads have been attending Buffett's concerts for decades, and they have created a sense of community and camaraderie around his music. Buffett has encouraged this phenomenon, and he often interacts with his fans through social media and at his live shows.

# Writing

Buffett's writing often reflects his love of the ocean and his tropical lifestyle. He has also written articles and essays for various publications, including Rolling Stone and The New York Times.

# Film and television

## Restaurants

## Sports

Buffett has invested in several sports teams, including the Boston Red Sox and the Miami Dolphins.

## Video games

## Retirement communities

## Berkshire Hathaway

Buffett has invested in Berkshire Hathaway, the conglomerate led by Warren Buffett (no relation). He has also partnered with Berkshire Hathaway on several business ventures.

# Charity work

article:
Open-source video game
======================

An open-source video game is a video game whose source code is made available to the public and is licensed in a way that allows users to study, modify, and distribute the code. This approach to game development allows for a collaborative and community-driven process, where developers and players can contribute to the game's creation and improvement.

Definition and differentiation
-----------------------------

Open-source video games are distinct from free-to-play games, which are games that can be played without a upfront cost but may have restrictions on gameplay or in-game purchases. Open-source games are also different from freeware games, which are games that can be downloaded and played for free but whose source code is not made available. Open-source games are typically distributed under licenses that allow users to modify and distribute the code, such as the GNU General Public License (GPL) or the MIT License.

Background
----------

The concept of open-source software has been around since the 1980s, but it wasn't until the 1990s that the idea of open-source game development began to take shape. The rise of the internet and the availability of game development tools and resources made it possible for developers to collaborate on game projects and share their code with others.

History
--------

### Beginnings and early games

One of the earliest examples of an open-source video game is the 1993 game "Doom," which was released by id Software under a permissive license that allowed users to modify and distribute the game's source code. This led to the creation of numerous modifications, or "mods," that added new features and gameplay mechanics to the game.

In the late 1990s and early 2000s, other open-source games began to emerge, such as "FreeCiv" and "FreeDoom." These games were often created by small teams of developers who were passionate about game development and wanted to create games that were free and open to the public.

### 3D games and source releases

The release of the source code for the 3D game engine "Quake" in 1999 marked a significant milestone in the development of open-source games. The "Quake" engine was widely used in the game development industry, and its release under an open-source license allowed developers to create their own 3D games using the engine.

Other 3D game engines, such as the "Unreal Engine" and the "id Tech 3" engine, were also released under open-source licenses, allowing developers to create complex and visually stunning games. This led to the creation of numerous open-source 3D games, such as "Unvanquished" and "Nexuiz."

### Rise in popularity and diversity

In the mid-2000s, open-source games began to gain popularity, with the release of games such as "Battle for Wesnoth" and "Glest." These games were created by large communities of developers and featured complex gameplay mechanics and engaging storylines.

The rise of digital distribution platforms, such as Steam and GOG.com, also helped to increase the visibility of open-source games. These platforms allowed developers to distribute their games to a wide audience and provided a convenient way for players to discover and download open-source games.

### Greater organization

As the open-source game development community grew, so did the need for greater organization and coordination. The creation of websites such as OpenGameArt.org and Open Source Games provided a central hub for developers to share their work and collaborate on projects.

The rise of social media and online communities also helped to facilitate communication and collaboration among developers. Platforms such as GitHub and GitLab allowed developers to share their code and collaborate on projects in real-time.

### Hubs and development teams

Today, there are numerous hubs and development teams dedicated to open-source game development. The Open Source Game Development community on GitHub is one of the largest and most active communities, with over 10,000 members and numerous projects in development.

Other notable hubs and development teams include the OpenGameArt.org community, which provides a repository of open-source game art and assets, and the Liberated Games community, which focuses on creating open-source versions of popular games.

See also
--------

* Free and open-source software
* Open-source software
* Free-to-play
* Freeware
* Modding
* Game development

References
----------

External links
---------------

* OpenGameArt.org
* Open Source Games
* GitHub - Open Source Game Development community
* Liberated Games

Tsumyoki
================

Tsumyoki is a Japanese electronic music producer and DJ who has gained significant attention in recent years for his unique blend of traditional Japanese sounds and modern electronic dance music. Born and raised in Tokyo, Japan, Tsumyoki's music often incorporates elements of Japanese culture, folklore, and mythology, setting him apart from other electronic music artists.

Early Life
------------

Tsumyoki was born on November 12, 1995, in Tokyo, Japan. Growing up in a culturally rich and vibrant city, he was exposed to a wide range of musical influences from an early age. His parents, both music lovers, encouraged his interest in music, and he began taking piano lessons at the age of 6. As he grew older, Tsumyoki became increasingly fascinated with electronic music, particularly the works of Japanese artists such as Ryuichi Sakamoto and Haruomi Hosono.

Career
--------

### 2018–2019: Early Beginnings

Tsumyoki's music career began in 2018 when he started producing tracks in his bedroom studio. He was largely self-taught, learning the basics of music production through online tutorials and YouTube videos. Initially, his music was heavily influenced by Western electronic dance music, but as he delved deeper into his Japanese heritage, he began to incorporate traditional Japanese sounds and instruments into his productions.

In 2019, Tsumyoki released his debut single, "Sakura," which gained moderate attention on social media platforms. The track's unique blend of traditional Japanese instruments and modern electronic beats caught the attention of several Japanese music bloggers, who praised Tsumyoki's innovative approach to electronic music.

### 2019–present: Rise to Success

Tsumyoki's breakthrough came in 2019 with the release of his debut EP, "Kokoro." The EP's lead single, "Kintsugi," featuring Japanese vocalist Aimer, became a viral hit on YouTube and TikTok, racking up millions of views and streams. The track's success led to Tsumyoki signing with a major Japanese record label, Pony Canyon, and embarking on his first national tour.

Since then, Tsumyoki has released several critically acclaimed albums and EPs, including "Yūgen" (2020) and "Garden" (2022). His music has been praised for its unique blend of traditional Japanese sounds and modern electronic production, and he has collaborated with several high-profile artists, including Japanese rapper Zorn and British producer Four Tet.

Goa Trap Culture
-----------------

Tsumyoki is often credited with helping to popularize the "Goa Trap" genre, a subgenre of electronic dance music that combines elements of Goa trance and trap music. Goa Trap emerged in the early 2010s, primarily in Japan and India, and is characterized by its fast-paced, psychedelic rhythms and often incorporates traditional Indian and Japanese instruments.

Tsumyoki's music often incorporates elements of Goa Trap, particularly in his earlier works. However, he has also experimented with a wide range of other styles, including ambient, house, and techno. His music is known for its atmospheric soundscapes and often features intricate melodies and rhythms.

Discography

### Singles and Collaborations

Awards and Nominations
----------------------

Tsumyoki has received several awards and nominations for his music, including:

* Best New Artist at the 2020 Japan Music Awards
* Best Electronic Album for "Yūgen" at the 2021 Japan Music Awards
* Nomination for Best Dance Recording for "Kintsugi" at the 2020 Japan Record Awards

Tours
------

Tsumyoki has embarked on several national and international tours, including:

* "Kokoro" Tour (2019-2020)
* "Yūgen" Tour (2020-2021)
* "Garden" Tour (2022-2023)

Notes
------

Tsumyoki's music has been praised for its unique blend of traditional Japanese sounds and modern electronic production. He has been credited with helping to popularize the Goa Trap genre and has collaborated with several high-profile artists. With his innovative approach to electronic music, Tsumyoki continues to be one of the most exciting and promising young artists in the Japanese music scene.

2022 Korea Masters

The 2022 Korea Masters was a badminton tournament that took place at the Gwangju Women's University Stadium in Gwangju, South Korea, from April 12 to 17, 2022. It was the sixth tournament of the 2022 BWF World Tour and was part of the Korea Masters championships, which had been held annually since 2007.

# Tournament

## Venue

The tournament was held at the Gwangju Women's University Stadium in Gwangju, South Korea. The stadium has a seating capacity of 10,000 and has hosted several major badminton tournaments in the past.

## Point distribution

The 2022 Korea Masters was a Super 300 tournament, which meant that it offered a total of 11,000 BWF World Tour points to the winners. The points were distributed as follows:

* Winner: 7,000 points
* Runner-up: 5,950 points
* Semi-finalist: 4,900 points
* Quarter-finalist: 3,850 points
* Round of 16: 2,800 points
* Round of 32: 1,750 points

## Prize pool

article:
2023–24 Figure Skating Season

The 2023–24 figure skating season began on July 1, 2023, and will end on June 30, 2024. During this period, elite figure skaters will compete on the international senior level in men's singles, ladies' singles, pair skating, and ice dance at various events, including the ISU Championships and the ISU Grand Prix series. The season's highlight will be the 2024 World Figure Skating Championships, which will take place in Montreal, Canada.

# Season notes

## Age eligibility

To be eligible to compete in senior-level events, skaters must be at least 15 years old before July 1, 2023. Skaters must also meet the minimum technical element score (TES) requirements at an ISU-recognized international competition to compete at the World Championships or the European Championships.

# Changes

## Partnership changes

Several partnership changes occurred during the off-season. In pairs, Vanessa James and Eric Radford of Canada announced their partnership after Radford's previous partner, Meagan Duhamel, retired. In ice dance, Madison Chock and Evan Bates of the United States announced their partnership after Bates' previous partner, Emily Samuelson, retired.

## Retirements

Several skaters announced their retirement from competitive figure skating during the off-season. In men's singles, Nathan Chen of the United States announced his retirement after winning three World Championships titles. In ladies' singles, Kaori Sakamoto of Japan announced her retirement after winning the 2022 World Championships title. In pairs, Meagan Duhamel and Eric Radford of Canada announced their retirement after winning two World Championships titles.

## Coaching changes

Several skaters changed coaches during the off-season. In men's singles, Yuzuru Hanyu of Japan announced that he would be working with a new coaching team, led by Brian Orser. In ladies' singles, Rika Kihira of Japan announced that she would be working with a new coaching team, led by Mie Hamada.

## Nationality changes

Several skaters changed their nationality during the off-season. In men's singles, Jin Boyang of China announced that he would be competing for the United States. In ladies' singles, Anastasiia Gubanova of Russia announced that she would be competing for Georgia.

# International competitions

## Cancelled

The 2023 ISU World Team Trophy, which was scheduled to take place in Tokyo, Japan, was cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

article:
Tropical Storm Alex (2022)

Tropical Storm Alex was a tropical cyclone that formed in the Atlantic Ocean in June 2022. The storm was the first named storm of the 2022 Atlantic hurricane season, which officially began on June 1. Alex brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to several countries in the Caribbean and Florida, causing significant disruptions and damage.

#Meteorological history

Tropical Storm Alex originated from a tropical wave that emerged off the west coast of Africa on May 27, 2022. The wave moved westward across the Atlantic, gradually developing a closed circulation and increasing convection. By June 2, the system had become a tropical depression, located about 1,200 miles (1,900 km) east of the Lesser Antilles. The depression strengthened into Tropical Storm Alex on June 3, with maximum sustained winds of 40 mph (65 km/h).

Alex moved west-northwestward across the Atlantic, passing north of the Lesser Antilles on June 4. The storm encountered favorable environmental conditions, including low wind shear and warm sea surface temperatures, which allowed it to strengthen further. Alex reached its peak intensity on June 5, with maximum sustained winds of 70 mph (115 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 991 mbar (29.26 inHg).

On June 6, Alex began to interact with a mid-level trough, which caused the storm to slow down and turn northwestward. The storm made landfall in Cuba on June 7, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds to the island. Alex then moved into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, where it encountered cooler waters and increasing wind shear, causing it to weaken.

#Preparations and impact

##Cuba

Tropical Storm Alex brought significant impacts to Cuba, particularly in the western and central regions of the island. Heavy rainfall caused widespread flooding, with some areas receiving over 10 inches (250 mm) of rain. Strong winds also caused power outages and damage to buildings and infrastructure.

The Cuban government issued a tropical storm warning for the entire island, and evacuations were ordered for low-lying areas. Emergency responders were deployed to affected areas to assist with rescue and relief efforts.

##Florida

Tropical Storm Alex also brought significant impacts to southern Florida, particularly in the Miami-Dade and Broward counties. Heavy rainfall caused flooding in several areas, including Miami Beach, where waters rose to over 3 feet (90 cm) in some areas. Strong winds also caused power outages and damage to buildings and infrastructure.

The National Weather Service issued a tropical storm warning for the Miami-Dade and Broward counties, and a flood watch was issued for several areas. Emergency responders were deployed to affected areas to assist with rescue and relief efforts.

##The Bahamas

Tropical Storm Alex also brought impacts to the Bahamas, particularly in the northern islands. Heavy rainfall caused flooding in several areas, and strong winds caused power outages and damage to buildings and infrastructure.

The Bahamian government issued a tropical storm warning for the entire archipelago, and evacuations were ordered for low-lying areas. Emergency responders were deployed to affected areas to assist with rescue and relief efforts.

The 2022 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup was the fifth edition of the FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup, an international youth basketball tournament organized by the International Basketball Federation (FIBA). The tournament was held in Spain from July 2 to July 10, 2022.

article:
The Menu (2022 film)

The Menu is a 2022 American black comedy horror-thriller film directed by Mark Mylod and written by Seth Reiss and Will Tracy. The film stars Ralph Fiennes, Anya Taylor-Joy, Nicholas Hoult, and Hong Chau, among others. It follows a young couple who visit a remote island to dine at an exclusive restaurant, only to find themselves embroiled in a sinister plot.

# Plot

The film takes place on a remote island, where a young couple, Tyler (Nicholas Hoult) and Maddy (Anya Taylor-Joy), have arrived to dine at the exclusive Hawthorne restaurant. The restaurant, run by the enigmatic Chef Slowik (Ralph Fiennes), is known for its unique and expensive dining experience. The couple is joined by a group of wealthy and influential patrons, including a food critic, a wealthy couple, and a businessman.

As the evening progresses, the guests begin to realize that something is off. The chef's behavior becomes increasingly erratic, and the guests start to vanish one by one. It becomes clear that the chef has a sinister plan, and the guests are trapped on the island with no way to escape.

As the night wears on, the guests are subjected to a series of gruesome and humiliating challenges, all designed to test their worthiness to dine at the exclusive restaurant. The film builds towards a shocking climax, as the guests fight for survival and the true nature of the chef's plan is revealed.

# Cast

* Ralph Fiennes as Chef Julian Slowik
* Anya Taylor-Joy as Maddy
* Nicholas Hoult as Tyler
* Hong Chau as Elsa
* Janet McTeer as Lillian Bloom
* Reed Birney as Richard
* Judith Light as Anne
* Paul Adelstein as Ted
* Rob Yang as Bryce
* Arturo Castro as Soren

# Production

## Development

The Menu was written by Seth Reiss and Will Tracy, and was inspired by their own experiences with fine dining and the exclusivity of high-end restaurants. The script was developed over several years, with the writers refining the story and characters.

Mark Mylod, a veteran director of film and television, was brought on board to direct the film. Mylod was drawn to the project by the script's unique blend of humor and horror, and saw an opportunity to create a film that would challenge and subvert audience expectations.

## Casting

The cast of The Menu was assembled over several months, with the writers and director working closely to find the right actors for each role. Ralph Fiennes was the first actor to be cast, and his involvement helped to attract other high-profile stars to the project.

Anya Taylor-Joy and Nicholas Hoult were cast as the young couple at the center of the film, and brought a youthful energy to the project. Hong Chau, Janet McTeer, and Judith Light were also cast in key roles, bringing their own unique perspectives and talents to the film.

## Filming

The Menu was filmed on location in Spain, over the course of several weeks. The film's remote island setting was created using a combination of location shooting and CGI, with the production team working to create a sense of isolation and claustrophobia.

The film's cast and crew worked closely together to create a sense of tension and unease, with the director using a range of techniques to build suspense and create a sense of unease.

## Music

The score for The Menu was composed by Colin Stetson, who worked closely with the director to create a unique and unsettling soundtrack. The score features a range of instruments, including piano, strings, and woodwind, and was designed to create a sense of unease and tension.

# Release

The Menu was released in the United States on November 18, 2022, by Searchlight Pictures. The film received a limited release, playing in select theaters and festivals before expanding to a wider release.

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its unique blend of humor and horror, as well as its thought-provoking themes and social commentary.

# Reception

## Box office

The Menu performed well at the box office, grossing over $50 million worldwide on a budget of $30 million. The film's success was driven by positive word-of-mouth and critical acclaim, with many audiences drawn to its unique and unsettling premise.

## Critical response

The Menu received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its unique blend of humor and horror, as well as its thought-provoking themes and social commentary. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising its originality, wit, and performances.

## Accolades

The Menu received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Original Screenplay at the Academy Awards. The film also won several awards at film festivals, including the Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival.

# Notes

The Menu has been praised for its thought-provoking themes and social commentary, with many seeing it as a commentary on the exclusivity and elitism of high-end restaurants. The film has also been praised for its unique blend of humor and horror, with many praising its originality and wit.

article:
2022 Italian General Election

The 2022 Italian general election was held on 25 September 2022 to elect the members of the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate of the Republic for the 19th legislature of the Italian Republic. The election was called after the resignation of Prime Minister Mario Draghi and the subsequent collapse of his government.

# Background

The 2022 Italian general election was the third general election to be held in Italy in the last five years, following the 2018 general election and the 2020 regional elections. The election was also the first to be held since the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on Italian politics and society.

The election was marked by a high level of fragmentation among the parties, with several new parties and alliances emerging in the run-up to the election. The centre-left Democratic Party (PD) and the centre-right Forza Italia (FI) were the two largest parties in the outgoing government, but they faced significant challenges from the Five Star Movement (M5S) and the League (Lega), two populist parties that had gained significant support in recent years.

# Electoral Campaign

The electoral campaign was marked by a high level of polarization and controversy, with several parties and candidates engaging in negative campaigning and personal attacks. The campaign was also marked by a significant increase in the use of social media and online platforms, which played a major role in shaping public opinion and influencing the outcome of the election.

## Main Parties' Slogans

The main parties' slogans for the 2022 Italian general election were:

* Democratic Party (PD): "Scegliamo il futuro" ("We choose the future")
* Five Star Movement (M5S): "Il cambiamento è possibile" ("Change is possible")
* League (Lega): "Prima gli italiani" ("Italians first")
* Forza Italia (FI): "L'Italia per gli italiani" ("Italy for Italians")
* Brothers of Italy (FdI): "L'Italia ai primi posti" ("Italy in the top spots")

## Electoral Debates

There were several electoral debates held during the campaign, featuring the leaders of the main parties. The debates were broadcast on television and online platforms, and were widely followed by the public.

# Electoral System

The electoral system used in the 2022 Italian general election was a mixed system, combining elements of proportional representation and first-past-the-post (FPTP) voting. The system was introduced in 2017, and was used for the first time in the 2018 general election.

Under the system, 37% of the seats in the Chamber of Deputies and 34% of the seats in the Senate of the Republic were allocated using FPTP voting in single-member constituencies. The remaining seats were allocated using proportional representation in multi-member constituencies.

# Electoral Lists

There were several electoral lists that contested the 2022 Italian general election, representing a wide range of parties and alliances.

## Lists with Parliamentary Representation

The main lists with parliamentary representation were:

* Centre-left coalition: Democratic Party (PD), Left Ecology Freedom (SEL), and Italian Socialist Party (PSI)
* Centre-right coalition: Forza Italia (FI), League (Lega), and Brothers of Italy (FdI)
* Five Star Movement (M5S)
* Free and Equal (LeU)
* More Europe (+Eu)

## Lists without Parliamentary Representation

There were several lists that did not have parliamentary representation, including:

* Italian Radicals (Rad)
* Communist Party (PC)
* New Force (FN)
* CasaPound (CPI)

## Lists Running Only in Overseas Constituencies

There were several lists that ran only in the overseas constituencies, representing the interests of Italian citizens living abroad. These lists included:

* Italian Democratic Party (PDI)
* Union of Italians in the World (UMI)
* Associative Movement of Italians Abroad (MAIE)

# Opinion Polls

There were several opinion polls conducted during the campaign, which showed a high level of fragmentation among the parties and a significant increase in support for the centre-right coalition.

# Voter Turnout

The voter turnout for the 2022 Italian general election was 63.8%, which was down from the 72.9% turnout in the 2018 general election.

# Results

## Chamber of Deputies

### Overall Results

The overall results for the Chamber of Deputies were:

* Centre-right coalition: 237 seats (43.8% of the vote)
* Five Star Movement (M5S): 105 seats (15.4% of the vote)
* Centre-left coalition: 85 seats (19.1% of the vote)
* Free and Equal (LeU): 12 seats (3.2% of the vote)
* More Europe (+Eu): 2 seats (2.5% of the vote)

### Proportional and FPTP Results

The proportional and FPTP results for the Chamber of Deputies were:

* Proportional representation: Centre-right coalition 114 seats, Five Star Movement (M5S) 72 seats, Centre-left coalition 54 seats

The results of the 2022 Italian general election were widely seen as a victory for the centre-right coalition, which won a majority of the seats in both the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate of the Republic. The election was also seen as a defeat for the centre-left coalition, which lost a significant number of seats.

The leaders of the main parties all reacted to the results of the election. Matteo Salvini, the leader of the League (Lega), said that the results were a "triumph" for the centre-right coalition. Killing of Jordan Neely

The killing of Jordan Neely was a highly publicized incident that occurred on May 1, 2023, in New York City. Neely, a 30-year-old African American man, was choked to death by Daniel Penny, a 24-year-old white man, on a subway train in Manhattan. The incident sparked widespread outrage and protests, with many calling for justice and an end to police brutality.

# Incident

On May 1, 2023, Jordan Neely boarded a subway train in Manhattan, where he was reportedly acting erratically and causing a disturbance. Witnesses described Neely as being agitated and loud, but not violent. Daniel Penny, who was also on the train, approached Neely and attempted to calm him down. However, the situation escalated, and Penny ended up choking Neely to death.

The incident was captured on video by several witnesses, which showed Penny holding Neely in a chokehold for several minutes. Despite the efforts of bystanders to intervene, Penny refused to release Neely, even after he had lost consciousness. The video footage, which was widely shared on social media, sparked outrage and condemnation from the public.

# People involved

## Jordan Neely

Jordan Neely was a 30-year-old African American man who was born and raised in New York City. Neely had a history of mental health issues and had been involved in several altercations with law enforcement in the past. Despite his struggles, Neely was described by friends and family as a kind and gentle person who was loved by those who knew him.

## Daniel Penny

Daniel Penny is a 24-year-old white man who was born and raised in New York City. Penny had no prior history of violence or crime, and his motives for attacking Neely are still unclear. Penny's lawyer has claimed that he was acting in self-defense, but many have disputed this claim, arguing that Penny's actions were excessive and unjustified.

# Legal proceedings

The investigation into Neely's death is ongoing, with the NYPD and the Manhattan District Attorney's office working to determine the circumstances surrounding the incident. The Masked Singer (American TV series) season 9
=====================================================

The ninth season of the American television series The Masked Singer premiered on February 15, 2023, on Fox. The season features a new group of celebrities competing against each other in elaborate costumes and masks, with the goal of being the last one standing and taking home the coveted Golden Mask trophy.

Panelists and Host
------------------

The panelists for this season are Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy Wahlberg, Nicole Scherzinger, and Robin Thicke. The show is hosted by Nick Cannon, who returns for his ninth season as the host.

Production
------------

The ninth season of The Masked Singer was produced by Fox Alternative Entertainment and Smart Dog Media. The show is executive produced by Craig Plestis, Izzie Pick Ibarra, and Nick Cannon.

Contestants
------------

This season features a total of 21 contestants, all of whom are competing in elaborate costumes and masks. The contestants are:

* Abba- Cadabra (played by Debbie Gibson)
* Alpine (played by Jeremiah Brent)
* Astronaut (played by Chris Kattan)
* Axolotl (played by Jorge Lendeborg Jr.)
* Bank Robber (played by Chris Daughtry)
* Beetle (played by Jennifer Nettles)
* Canary (played by Kelsy Karter)
* Cerberus (played by Hayley Orrantia)
* Chuck Berry (played by Lance Bass)
* Disco Ball (played by Duff Goldman)
* Firefly (played by T-Pain)
* Gargoyle (played by Jordan Sparks)
* Harp (played by Tamar Braxton)
* Marmaduke (played by Adam DeVine)
* Peacemaker (played by Jason Schwartzman)
* Phoenix (played by Donny Osmond)
* S'mores (played by Jason Mraz)
* Squirrel (played by Nicole Byer)
* Unicorn (played by Daymond John)
* Viking (played by Christopher Lloyd)
* Yeti (played by Charles Oakley)

Episodes
----------

### Week 1 (February 15)

The season premiere introduced the 21 contestants competing in the season. The first group of contestants to perform were Abba-Cadabra, Alpine, Astronaut, Axolotl, and Bank Robber. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Abba-Cadabra, who performed a rendition of " Dancing Queen". The first contestant to be eliminated was Axolotl.

### Week 2 (February 22) - "ABBA Night"

The second episode of the season featured the remaining 20 contestants performing ABBA songs. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Canary, who performed a rendition of "Mamma Mia". The second contestant to be eliminated was Beetle.

### Week 3 (March 1) - "New York Night"

The third episode of the season featured the remaining 19 contestants performing songs that are iconic of New York City. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Firefly, who performed a rendition of "Empire State of Mind". The third contestant to be eliminated was S'mores.

### Week 4 (March 8) - "DC Superheroes Night"

The fourth episode of the season featured the remaining 18 contestants performing songs that are iconic of DC superheroes. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Harp, who performed a rendition of "Superhero". The fourth contestant to be eliminated was Gargoyle.

### Week 5 (March 15) - "Sesame Street Night"

The fifth episode of the season featured the remaining 17 contestants performing songs from Sesame Street. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Chuck Berry, who performed a rendition of " Rubber Duckie". The fifth contestant to be eliminated was Unicorn.

### Week 6 (March 22) - "Country Night"

The sixth episode of the season featured the remaining 16 contestants performing country songs. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Squirrel, who performed a rendition of "Friends in Low Places". The sixth contestant to be eliminated was Yeti.

### Week 7 (March 29) - "'80s Night"

The seventh episode of the season featured the remaining 15 contestants performing songs from the 1980s. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Astronaut, who performed a rendition of "Don't Stop Believin'". The seventh contestant to be eliminated was Viking.

### Week 8 (April 5) - "WB Movie Night"

The eighth episode of the season featured the remaining 14 contestants performing songs from Warner Bros. movies. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Phoenix, who performed a rendition of "Can You Feel the Love Tonight". The eighth contestant to be eliminated was Cerberus.

### Week 9 (April 12) - "Masked Singer In Space"

The ninth episode of the season featured the remaining 13 contestants performing space-themed songs. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Peacemaker, who performed a rendition of "Space Oddity". The ninth contestant to be eliminated was Marmaduke.

### Week 10 (April 19) - "Supreme Six"

The tenth episode of the season featured the remaining 12 contestants performing in groups of two. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Abba-Cadabra and Firefly, who performed a rendition of "We Are the Champions". The tenth contestant to be eliminated was Bank Robber.

### Week 11 (April 26) - "Battle of the Saved"

The eleventh episode of the season featured the remaining 11 contestants competing against each other in a battle round. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Canary, who performed a rendition of "I Will Always Love You". The eleventh contestant to be eliminated was Axolotl.

### Week 12 (May 3) - "Quarter Finals" (British Invasion Night)

The twelfth episode of the season featured the remaining 10 contestants performing songs from the British Invasion. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Harp, who performed a rendition of "Yesterday". The twelfth contestant to be eliminated was Alpine.

### Week 13 (May 10) - "Semi-Finals"

The thirteenth episode of the season featured the remaining 8 contestants competing against each other in the semi-finals. The judges' favorite performance of the night was Abba-Cadabra, who performed a rendition of "Bohemian Rhapsody". The thirteenth and fourteenth contestants to be eliminated were Astronaut and Phoenix.

### Week 14 (May 17) - "Finale"

The season finale featured the remaining 5 contestants competing against each other in the final round. The winner of the season was Abba-Cadabra, who was revealed to be Debbie Gibson.

Ratings
--------

The ninth season of The Masked Singer averaged a 2.5 rating in the 18-49 demographic and 8.1 million viewers per episode.

Notes
------

This season of The Masked Singer featured a new format, with the contestants competing in groups and the judges' favorite performance of the night being revealed at the end of each episode. The season also featured a number of guest judges, including Gordon Ramsay and Neil Patrick Harris.

article:
Minions: The Rise of Gru

Minions: The Rise of Gru is a 2022 American computer-animated comedy film produced by Illumination and distributed by Universal Pictures. The film is a sequel to the 2015 film Minions and the fifth installment in the Despicable Me franchise. It explores the origins of the Minions and their encounter with a young Gru, who would eventually become their boss.

#Plot

The film takes place in the 1970s, during the height of the disco era. The story revolves around a 12-year-old Gru, who dreams of becoming a supervillain. Gru is an outcast among his peers and is desperate to prove himself. He applies to join the Vicious 6, a group of elite villains, but is rejected due to his young age.

Meanwhile, the Minions, led by Kevin, Stuart, and Bob, are searching for a new leader after their previous one abandoned them. They stumble upon Gru and decide to follow him, believing he has the potential to become a great villain.

Gru and the Minions embark on a series of misadventures, including a wild goose chase through San Francisco and a showdown with the Vicious 6. Along the way, Gru learns the value of friendship and teamwork, and the Minions discover their loyalty and dedication to their new leader.

#Voice cast

The film features an all-star voice cast, including Steve Carell as Gru, Pierre Coffin as the Minions, and Alan Arkin as Wild Knuckles, a veteran villain and member of the Vicious 6. The cast also includes Taraji P. Henson as Belle Bottom, a sassy and seductive villain, and Michelle Yeoh as Master Chow, a martial arts expert and member of the Vicious 6.

#Production

Minions: The Rise of Gru was directed by Kyle Balda, who previously co-directed the first Minions film. The screenplay was written by Matthew Fogel, who also wrote the screenplay for the first film. The film was produced by Chris Renaud, Janet Healy, and Chris Meledandri.

The film's animation was created by Illumination Mac Guff, a French animation studio that has worked on several Illumination films. The studio used a combination of computer-generated imagery (CGI) and traditional animation techniques to create the film's colorful and stylized visuals.

#Music

The film's soundtrack features a mix of classic disco hits and original songs. The soundtrack includes songs by artists such as the Bee Gees, Chic, and KC and the Sunshine Band. The film's score was composed by Heitor Pereira, who previously worked on the Despicable Me franchise.

#Marketing and release

Minions: The Rise of Gru was released in the United States on July 1, 2022. The film was originally scheduled for release in July 2020, but was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The film's marketing campaign included a series of trailers and TV spots, as well as promotional partnerships with brands such as McDonald's and General Mills. The film's social media campaign encouraged fans to share their own Minion-inspired content using the hashtag #MinionsRise.

##Box office

Minions: The Rise of Gru was a commercial success, grossing over $939 million worldwide. The film opened at number one in the United States, earning $107 million in its opening weekend. The film's success was driven by strong performances in international markets, particularly in China and the United Kingdom.

##Critical response

Minions: The Rise of Gru received generally positive reviews from critics. The film holds a 72% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 222 reviews. The critical consensus reads: "Minions: The Rise of Gru is a fun and funny sequel that explores the origins of our favorite yellow creatures."

Some critics praised the film's visuals and animation, while others noted that the story was predictable and formulaic. However, most critics agreed that the film's humor and charm made it an enjoyable watch.

###Gentleminions TikTok trend

During the film's opening weekend, a viral trend emerged on TikTok, in which groups of young men dressed in suits and sunglasses, mimicking the film's characters, attended screenings of the film. The trend, dubbed "Gentleminions," was seen as a playful and ironic take on the film's themes of masculinity and villainy.

##Accolades

Minions: The Rise of Gru received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Animated Feature at the 2023 Golden Globe Awards. The film also won several awards at the 2023 Kids' Choice Awards, including Favorite Animated Movie and Favorite Voice from an Animated Movie (Steve Carell).

#Sequel

A sequel to Minions: The Rise of Gru is currently in development, with Chris Renaud set to direct. The film is expected to explore the further adventures of Gru and the Minions, and will likely feature many of the same characters and themes as the original film.

#See also

* Despicable Me franchise
* Minions (film)
* Illumination (animation studio)
* Computer-generated imagery (CGI)

#Notes

Minions: The Rise of Gru is the fifth film in the Despicable Me franchise, and the third film to focus on the Minions characters. The film's success has solidified the Minions as one of the most popular and enduring animated franchises of the past decade.

#References

2022

2022 was a common year that started on a Saturday and ended on a Saturday, according to the Gregorian calendar. It was the 22nd year of the 21st century and the 2020s decade. The year was marked by significant global events, including ongoing conflicts, natural disasters, and major developments in science, technology, and politics.

# Conflicts

The year 2022 saw ongoing conflicts in various parts of the world, including the Russo-Ukrainian War, the Syrian Civil War, and the Yemeni Civil War. The conflict in Ukraine escalated in February, with Russia launching a large-scale invasion of the country, leading to widespread condemnation and economic sanctions from the international community.

The conflict in Syria continued, with the Assad regime maintaining control over most of the country, despite ongoing rebel activity and Turkish military intervention. The Yemeni Civil War also persisted, with the Houthi rebels controlling the capital city of Sana'a and the Saudi-led coalition continuing to conduct airstrikes against rebel positions.

# Events

## January

The year began with the COVID-19 pandemic still affecting many countries around the world. The Omicron variant, which had emerged in late 2021, continued to spread rapidly, leading to increased case numbers and hospitalizations.

In the United States, the January 6 United States Capitol attack anniversary was marked with solemn ceremonies and speeches, as the country reflected on the one-year anniversary of the violent storming of the Capitol building by supporters of then-President Donald Trump.

## February

The Winter Olympics took place in Beijing, China, from February 4 to 20. The games were marked by controversy, with several countries boycotting the event due to China's human rights record and concerns over the safety of athletes.

On February 24, Russia launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine, marking a significant escalation of the conflict between the two countries. The invasion was widely condemned by the international community, with many countries imposing economic sanctions on Russia and providing military aid to Ukraine.

## March

The conflict in Ukraine continued to dominate global headlines, with Russian forces making significant gains in the country's eastern regions. The international community continued to condemn Russia's actions, with the United States and European Union imposing further sanctions on the country.

In the United States, the Supreme Court heard oral arguments in the case of Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, which challenged the constitutionality of abortion restrictions in the state of Mississippi. The case was widely seen as a potential challenge to the landmark Roe v. Wade decision, which had established a woman's right to an abortion in the United States.

## April

The conflict in Ukraine showed no signs of abating, with Russian forces continuing to shell Ukrainian cities and the international community providing increasing amounts of military aid to Ukraine.

In the United States, the Biden administration announced plans to end the Title 42 public health order, which had allowed the government to expel migrants at the US-Mexico border due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The move was widely seen as a significant shift in the administration's immigration policy.

## May

The conflict in Ukraine continued, with Russian forces making slow gains in the country's eastern regions. The international community continued to provide military aid to Ukraine, with the United States and European Union imposing further sanctions on Russia.

In the United States, the Supreme Court leaked a draft opinion in the case of Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, which suggested that the court was poised to overturn the landmark Roe v. Wade decision. The leak sparked widespread protests and condemnation from abortion rights activists.

## June

Wade decision and ending the constitutional right to an abortion in the United States. The decision sparked widespread protests and condemnation from abortion rights activists.

## August

The conflict in Ukraine showed no signs of abating, with Russian forces continuing to shell Ukrainian cities and the international community providing increasing amounts of military aid to Ukraine.

In the United States, the FBI executed a search warrant at the Mar-a-Lago estate of former President Donald Trump, sparking widespread controversy and condemnation from Trump's supporters.

## September

The conflict in Ukraine continued, with Russian forces making slow gains in the country's eastern regions. The international community continued to provide military aid to Ukraine, with the United States and European Union imposing further sanctions on Russia.

In the United States, the Biden administration announced plans to forgive up to $20,000 in student loan debt for millions of Americans, sparking widespread praise from liberal activists and condemnation from conservatives.

## October

The conflict in Ukraine showed no signs of abating, with Russian forces continuing to shell Ukrainian cities and the international community providing increasing amounts of military aid to Ukraine.

In the United States, the 2022 midterm elections took place, with Republicans making significant gains in the House of Representatives and Democrats maintaining control of the Senate.

## November

The conflict in Ukraine continued, with Russian forces making slow gains in the country's eastern regions. The international community continued to provide military aid to Ukraine, with the United States and European Union imposing further sanctions on Russia.

In the United States, the Biden administration announced plans to restrict asylum claims at the US-Mexico border, sparking widespread condemnation from immigrant rights activists.

## December

In the United States, the House of Representatives voted to impeach President Joe Biden on charges related to his handling of the border crisis, sparking widespread controversy and condemnation from Democrats.

# Demographics

The world population reached approximately 7.92 billion people in 2022, with the population of Asia making up around 60% of the total.

The median age of the world population was approximately 31.4 years, with the population of Europe having the highest median age at around 42.5 years.

# Deaths

Several notable individuals died in 2022, including:

* Queen Elizabeth II, the monarch of the United Kingdom, who died on September 8 at the age of 96.

2023 Miami Open – Men's singles

The 2023 Miami Open – Men's singles was the main men's event of the 2023 Miami Open, a premier mandatory tennis tournament on the ATP Tour. It was the 38th edition of the Miami Open and took place from March 21 to April 2, 2023, on the outdoor hard courts of the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida, United States.
